body:
@tadwiew does this replicate without the --metadata flag?

I wonder if we are preserving chunked encoding from the metadata?

Yes, without --metadata flag copy goes OK.
rclone copyto -vv
 do-weedvader:weedvader/static/1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg
s3-weedvader:weedvader-objects/static/test06.jpg
2025/08/04 09:47:57 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.71.0-beta.8968.d4e68bf66"
starting with parameters ["rclone" "copyto" "-vv"
"do-weedvader:weedvader/static/1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg"
"s3-weedvader:weedvader-objects/static/test06.jpg"]
2025/08/04 09:47:57 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote
"do-weedvader:weedvader/static/1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg"
2025/08/04 09:47:57 DEBUG : Using config file from
"/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2025/08/04 09:47:57 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming child cache item
"do-weedvader:weedvader/static/1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg"
to be canonical for parent "do-weedvader:weedvader/static"
2025/08/04 09:47:57 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote
"s3-weedvader:weedvader-objects/static/"
2025/08/04 09:47:57 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item
"s3-weedvader:weedvader-objects/static/" to be canonical
"s3-weedvader:weedvader-objects/static"
2025/08/04 09:47:57 DEBUG : 1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg:
Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2025/08/04 09:47:58 DEBUG : 1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg: md5
= 1c52b19479d0ad99be8a5fe7734a5fb3 OK
2025/08/04 09:47:58 INFO  : 1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg:
Copied (new) to: test06.jpg
2025/08/04 09:47:58 INFO  :
Transferred:       87.547 KiB / 87.547 KiB, 100%, 0 B/s, ETA -
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         0.3s

2025/08/04 09:47:58 DEBUG : 7 go routines active

It also works with flag --s3-use-presigned-request or flag
--s3-upload-cutoff=0 .

Regards,

Tad

> .

If you do  

```
rclone lsf --metadata do-weedvader:weedvader/static/1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg s3-weedvader:weedvader-objects/static/test05.jpg
```

What do you get @tadwiew ?

Can you try the copy with `-vv --dump headers` and paste the result please? (Or at minimum the headers of the PUT request)

rclone lsf --metadata
do-weedvader:weedvader/static/1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg
1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg

***@***.*** ~]# rclone lsf --metadata
s3-weedvader:weedvader-objects/static/test05.jpg
test05.jpg

------------------------
Output of copy with --dump is in the attached file.

Regards,

Tad

    }
}
---------------------

https://sfo3.digitaloceanspaces.com --bucket weedvader --key

{
    "AcceptRanges": "bytes",
    "LastModified": "2025-05-30T12:28:31+00:00",
    "ContentLength": 89648,
    "ETag": "\"1c52b19479d0ad99be8a5fe7734a5fb3\"",

    "ContentEncoding": "aws-chunked",
    "ContentType": "image/jpeg",
    "Metadata": {}
}
------------
Regards,

Tad

@tadwiew can you attach the log I asked for here? It didn't attach when you emailed it. Thank you

Hi,

My emails shows that output of the command with dump option was sent ,,,
Anyway here I am attaching it again.
If this this not what you need - let me know and will run it again .

Tad


On Fri, Aug 15, 2025 at 4:27 PM Nick Craig-Wood ***@***.***>
wrote:

> *ncw* left a comment (rclone/rclone#8724)
> <https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8724#issuecomment-3192655211>
>
> @tadwiew <https://github.com/tadwiew> can you attach the log I asked for
> here? It didn't attach when you emailed it. Thank you
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8724#issuecomment-3192655211>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAZDVAPB67WAY2MN22EIDO33NY7CBAVCNFSM6AAAAACDANHJM2VHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZTCOJSGY2TKMRRGE>
> .
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

Got it now when you attached it on the issue (it doesn't come through via email) - thanks @tadwiew 

The request causing the error is this one

```
2025/08/04 14:36:34 DEBUG : PUT /static/test08.jpg?x-id=PutObject HTTP/1.1
Host: weedvader-objects.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com
User-Agent: rclone/v1.71.0-beta.8968.d4e68bf66
Content-Length: 89648
Accept-Encoding: identity
Amz-Sdk-Invocation-Id: 89f1a568-6ac2-4ace-8923-f2d2720d1951
Amz-Sdk-Request: attempt=1; max=1
Authorization: XXXX
Cache-Control: max-age=86400
Content-Encoding: aws-chunked
Content-Md5: HFKxlHnQrZm+il/nc0pfsw==
Content-Type: image/jpeg
X-Amz-Acl: bucket-owner-full-control
X-Amz-Content-Sha256: UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD
X-Amz-Date: 20250804T183634Z
X-Amz-Meta-Btime: 2025-05-30T12:28:31Z
X-Amz-Meta-Mtime: 1748608111
X-Amz-Storage-Class: STANDARD
```

And the error is this

> StatusCode: 400, RequestID: XXX, api error InvalidArgument: aws-chunked encoding is not supported when x-amz-content-sha256 UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD is supplied.

So where did the `Content-Encoding: aws-chunked` header come from? Rclone doesn't put those in.

A bit earlier rclone does a HEAD on the source object

```
2025/08/04 14:36:33 DEBUG : HEAD /static/1508204081-OG-Medicinals_Triangle_Kush.jpg HTTP/1.1
Host: weedvader.sfo3.digitaloceanspaces.com
User-Agent: rclone/v1.71.0-beta.8968.d4e68bf66
Accept-Encoding: identity
Amz-Sdk-Invocation-Id: 9a85effd-67db-4aa7-99ab-71b43bd5bb95
Amz-Sdk-Request: attempt=1; max=10
Authorization: XXXX
X-Amz-Content-Sha256: e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855
X-Amz-Date: 20250804T183633Z
```

And gets the response

```
2025/08/04 14:36:34 DEBUG : HTTP/2.0 200 OK
Content-Length: 89648
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Cache-Control: max-age=86400
Content-Encoding: aws-chunked
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Date: Mon, 04 Aug 2025 18:36:34 GMT
Etag: "1c52b19479d0ad99be8a5fe7734a5fb3"
Last-Modified: Fri, 30 May 2025 12:28:31 GMT
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=15552000; includeSubDomains; preload
Vary: Origin, Access-Control-Request-Headers, Access-Control-Request-Method
X-Amz-Request-Id: tx000006ac853f060de0acb-006890fdb2-8781ffa7-sfo3a
X-Rgw-Object-Type: Normal
```

Note the `Content-Encoding: aws-chunked` in the response. So what is happening is that with `--metadata` rclone is preserving the `Content-Encoding: aws-chunked` from the source and attempting to upload that to the destination.

Reading the docs here https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/sigv4-streaming.html I think `aws-chunked` as a content encoding is internal use and we shouldn't be attempting to preserve it in the metadata. In fact AWS S3 doesn't preserve it in the Content-Encoding and you never see it, so I think technically speaking this is a bug in digital ocean. It shouldn't be putting `aws-chunked` into the `Content-Type`.

I made a workaround for this which removes `aws-chunked` from the `Content-Type:` whenever it sees it. Please give this a go.

[v1.71.0-beta.8993.d87a197e5.fix-8724-s3-aws-chunked](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8724-s3-aws-chunked/v1.71.0-beta.8993.d87a197e5.fix-8724-s3-aws-chunked/) on branch [fix-8724-s3-aws-chunked](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8724-s3-aws-chunked) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
